ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned grammar and writing skills in French that helped me improve my fluency.
Learned a lot of conversational french skills and really improved my reading, writing, and grammar
I made medium-size advances in my understanding of French grammar moreso than french vocabulary.
My French feels more comfortable and going through all the grammar for a second time solidified it a lot.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wish there were more opportunities for revision of essays and I think it would have been helpful if quizzes were open note since they are intended to help us learn the material for tests.

This course was taught extremely well. The homework always helped with my knowledge and meeting every day was extremely helpful for building speaking skills. I realized that the best way to learn a language is to just keep practicing.

The most serious weakness of this course is the overambition of the workload. It expects a lot out of students, to the point that I would only expect someone whose main area of study was the French language to do that much French. Because of this, students try and find ways to tactically cut down on how much of the work they do. It would be better to have less work that students do consistently and find valuable enough to complete.

I liked the variety of media we consumed (including many books and a few movies) but at some points in the course you end up doing almost the same thing everyday with grammar worksheets and discussion questions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course, but you have to be serious about learning French and be willing to put in a lot of effort.
I would recommend, even if you are scared of the high workload.

I wouldn't recommend it, but the language requirement demands this level of course from most students. I would advise most students to steer clear of the French track for the language requirement completely, due to how much trouble it is compared to other departments.

Yes! This was one of my favorite courses this semester because I loved seeing my class everyday and developing a group friendship dynamic. It was great to practice my French in both a casual and academic setting which this class provided. Along with grammar practice and reading, we also discussed and talked throughout the class.
